alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 11 at 5:47AM CDT until July 11 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Bryan County in southeastern Oklahoma... Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 547 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Milburn to 3 miles northwest of Willis, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Durant, Madill, Tishomingo, Kingston, Colbert, Caddo, Bokchito, Achille, Bennington, Silo, Milburn, Tushka, Caney, Kenefic, Kemp, Mead, Armstrong, Hendrix, Cartwright, and Fillmore. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
